Package searcher

Class CleverSearcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • searcher.Searcher
      • searcher.CleverSearcher
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CleverSearcherTimer
    public class CleverSearcher
extends Searcher
    Better approach of finding element in given array at given position. Takes array as argument and temporary divides it into 2 small and big arrays, where small array elements are being swapped if bigger value is found
    Since:
    2018-10-08
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Domantas Giedraitis (student id: u1757704 )

    • Method Detail

      • findElement

        public int findElement()
                throws IndexingError
        Overrides findElement method from abstract class 'Searcher' Get array and element to look for. Check if given index is not out of bounds Create smaller array of size [given index], sorts it ASC and calls function findLargestNumberInArray to find element
        Specified by:
        findElement in class Searcher
        Returns:
        the element which we looking for
        Throws:
        IndexingError - if given index is not within specifications

      • sortSmallArray

        public static int sortSmallArray​(int[] smallArray,
                                 int[] bigArray,
                                 int index)
        Finds the K largest number in array
        Parameters:
        smallArray - Array of size [K] which 1st element will be element to return
        bigArray - Given array of elements. Used to compare the elements with smallArray
        index - Required index to find element in array
        Returns:
        First element of smallArray which is the k largest element
